answers.answer:
General assistance for new arrivals in Galați includes social and legal advice, various forms of social assistance such as vouchers, donations, and accommodation, as well as educational support, psychosocial services, and help with integration into the community and labor market.

To find more detailed information, refer to the introductory section and especially the 'Organisations offering their support' section within the provided text.

answers.answer:
You can contact the Galați County Immigration Service at gl.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0236 407 292 / 0236 407 000. For asylum services, reach the Regional Center for Procedures and Accommodation of Asylum Seekers at c.galati.igi@mai.gov.ro or 0236 323 878.

To find more detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the "Important contacts" section.

Registration for temporary protection in Galați can be done at the Regional Center for Procedures and Accommodation of Asylum Seekers Galați (Str. Săvinești, no. 2) or the Immigration Office of Galati County (Str. Domnească no. 102).

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and look under the "Temporary protection in Galați" section.

Children in Galați can attend state kindergartens and nurseries, or private kindergartens like Clever Kids. Extracurricular activities for Ukrainian children are available at School no. 16, while free Romanian language courses are offered by JRS and Romanian and English language courses by Fundatia Inimă de Copil.

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the "Education" section and also look under "Organisations offering their support" for details on JRS and Fundatia Inimă de Copil.
